comment.text: The translation key "DayOfTheMonth" is used to display a placeholder text for a calendar component that represents a specific day of the month. When there are no days in the selection (i.e., every day), it shows "Every Day Of The Month". This text appears in a dropdown select component, indicating available days of the month.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation "何日" while literally meaning 'what day', is a shorthand for 'day of the month'. A more accurate and complete translation would be something like "月の何日" (tsuki no nannichi) or simply "日付" (hizuke) depending on the desired level of formality and context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 月の何日 (tsuki no nannichi) or 日付 (hizuke)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation "날짜" (naljja) translates to "date" in general, not specifically "day of the month". While 'date' can encompass 'day of the month,' it's not a precise translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more specific translation like "월일" (wol-il), which directly means "day of the month", or "음력 날짜" (eumnyeok naljja) if the context implies a lunar calendar.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "මාසයේ දවස" literally translates to "day of the month" but the possessive particle '්' is misplaced. It should be 'මාසයේ දවස'.

The Serbian translation "Дан у месецу" literally translates to "Day in the month." While understandable, it's not the most natural or accurate translation of "Day of the month." A more idiomatic translation would be something like "Дан месеца".
The Ukrainian translation "День місяця" literally translates to "Day of the Moon" instead of "Day of the month".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: The correct translation should be "Число місяця" or "День місяця" can be used in certain contexts, but "Число місяця" is more accurate for the general meaning of 'Day of the month'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "月份日期" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Day of the month." "月份" refers to 'month,' and "日期" refers to 'date.' Combining them creates a literal but awkward translation. A more common and accurate translation would focus on the day within a month.
